intro: Ophiorrhiza austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan milk vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. It is native to China, particularly in the Yunnan province, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Ophiorrhiza austroyunnanensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
